findings.rationale: Joint ownership can lead to disputes over usage rights and commercialization of intellectual property developed under the Agreement.
findings.evidence_quote: All intellectual property developed under this Agreement shall be jointly owned by both parties.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to the total contract value may not adequately protect against significant damages resulting from breaches or negligence.
findings.evidence_quote: Neither party's liability shall exceed the total contract value.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at $500,000 may expose the Client to substantial risk if third-party claims exceed this amount.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider agrees to indemnify Client for third-party claims... up to a maximum of $500,000.

findings.rationale: A confidentiality obligation lasting only 3 years may not be sufficient for sensitive information, depending on the nature of the information.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidential information must be kept confidential for 3 years after termination.

findings.rationale: Specifying Delaware courts may limit options for resolving disputes, especially for parties located elsewhere.
findings.evidence_quote: Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of the State of Delaware.
